meanings.definition: Lack of agreement or harmony; inconsistency.
meanings.sent1: The inconformities in their opinions led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent2: The inconformities between their stories made it hard to determine the truth.
meanings.sent3: The inconformities in their fashion choices always made for interesting conversations.
meanings.sent4: The inconformities in their music tastes highlighted their diverse personalities.
meanings.sent5: The inconformities in the data caused confusion among the researchers.

meanings.definition: A deviation from the standard or norm.
meanings.sent1: Her unconventional approach was seen as an inconformity by her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The small inconformities in his behavior hinted at a larger issue.
meanings.sent3: The inconformity in his painting style made it stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent4: His decision to travel alone was an inconformity to societal expectations.
meanings.sent5: The inconformity in her handwriting made it unique and easily recognizable.

meanings.sent1: The inconformities in the test results puzzled the scientists.
meanings.sent2: There were inconformities in the witness statements that needed to be resolved.
meanings.sent3: The inconformities in the prices at different stores surprised the shoppers.
meanings.sent4: The inconformities in their memories of the event raised doubts about what really happened.
meanings.sent5: The inconformities in the sizes of the boxes caused confusion during packing.
